data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word اللَّيْلَ comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)

data.meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.
data.sentence: The word الشَّمْسَ comes from the root ش م س and is associated with the meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.

data.meanings: to be white. qamarun - moon (especially from the 3rd to 26th night).
data.sentence: The word وَالْقَمَرَ comes from the root ق م ر and is associated with the meanings: to be white. qamarun - moon (especially from the 3rd to 26th night).

data.meanings: to cause stream to flow, repulse, reproach, flow abundantly, drive back, brow beat, chide, do in the day time, day, daytime, daylight hours (from dawn to dusk).
data.sentence: The word وَالنَّهَارَ comes from the root ن ه ر and is associated with the meanings: to cause stream to flow, repulse, reproach, flow abundantly, drive back, brow beat, chide, do in the day time, day, daytime, daylight hours (from dawn to dusk).

data.meanings: to mock/laugh/scoff at, make fun of, ridicule, look down, deride, taunt, jeer, to compel to work without payment, make subservient, press into service, harness, bring under domination or control, subjugate, constrain anyone to forced work.
data.sentence: The word وَسَخَّرَ comes from the root س خ ر and is associated with the meanings: to mock/laugh/scoff at, make fun of, ridicule, look down, deride, taunt, jeer, to compel to work without payment, make subservient, press into service, harness, bring under domination or control, subjugate, constrain anyone to forced work.

data.meanings: to strive/exert/labour/toil, diligent, zealous, become wearied/fatigued, held on / continue, urge, to drive out/away, hunt, to pawn, to persevere, to persist, to last, to hold out.A custom/habit/manner/wont, an affair/business/concern, deed/work/condition.
data.sentence: The word دَائِبَيْنِ comes from the root د ا ب and is associated with the meanings: to strive/exert/labour/toil, diligent, zealous, become wearied/fatigued, held on / continue, urge, to drive out/away, hunt, to pawn, to persevere, to persist, to last, to hold out.A custom/habit/manner/wont, an affair/business/concern, deed/work/condition.
